header: Criminal Bail Application No. 211/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­000776­2019) Mahesh Shrihari Gadute & Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Lonikand P.S.)

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 Applicants Mahesh Shrihari Gadute and Kiran Baban Hargude have filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 21/2019 under Section 326, 324, 323, 504, 506, 143, 147, 148 of the Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under section 326, 324, 323, 504, 506, 143, 147, 148 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: [2] Heard the Ld. Counsel for the Applicants.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Heard the Ld. Counsel for the Applicants.

arguments.text: [3] The complainant Amit Bhandalkar lodged report with non­applicant on 09.01.2019 stating that Pooja Mahadik, daughter of his tenant told him that day before one, unknown boy was asking her mobile number. Today also that boy standing in front of their building. Therefore, complainant went to that boy to ask, why he is asking the mobile number of Pooja. At that time, that boy abused complainant and there was quarrel between them and that boy left. In the evening at 07.45 p.m. that unknown boy came in front of house of complainant along with his friend and started abusing and threatening complainant. That unknown boy beat the complainant with fist and kick blows. Ravi Hargude and Mahesh Gatude beat him with fist and kick blows. Kiran Hargude with iron rod on his right shoulder. When one Rajendra Lingse tried to intervene, at that time, Omkar Hargude beat him with some pointed instruments on his wrist. . On these allegations, FIR was lodged.

argumentSentences.text: [3] The complainant Amit Bhandalkar lodged report with non­applicant on 09.01.2019 stating that Pooja Mahadik, daughter of his tenant told him that day before one, unknown boy was asking her mobile number.
Today also that boy standing in front of their building.
Therefore, complainant went to that boy to ask, why he is asking the mobile number of Pooja.
At that time, that boy abused complainant and there was quarrel between them and that boy left.
In the evening at 07.45 p.m. that unknown boy came in front of house of complainant along with his friend and started abusing and threatening complainant.
That unknown boy beat the complainant with fist and kick blows.
Ravi Hargude and Mahesh Gatude beat him with fist and kick blows.
Kiran Hargude with iron rod on his right shoulder.
When one Rajendra Lingse tried to intervene, at that time, Omkar Hargude beat him with some pointed instruments on his wrist.
On these allegations, FIR was lodged.

arguments.text: [4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Nothing incriminating has to be discovered or recovered at the instance of applicants. Initially, the FIR was registered u/s 324 and other offences of IPC. Later on police added Section 326 of I.P.C. The alleged injuries are simple in nature. The applicants have not done any over act. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not necessary. Hence, prayed for ad­interim protection.

argumentSentences.text: [4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence.
The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required.
Nothing incriminating has to be discovered or recovered at the instance of applicants.
Initially, the FIR was registered u/s 324 and other offences of IPC.
Later on police added Section 326 of I.P.C.
The alleged injuries are simple in nature.
The applicants have not done any over act.
The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not necessary.
Hence, prayed for ad­interim protection.

arguments.text: [5] After hearing the Ld. Counsel for the applicants, there is reasonable apprehension in the mind of the applicants about their arrest at the hands of non­applicant. Hence, as settled position of Law, the Applicants are entitled for ad­interim Anticipatory bail till filing of reply by the Opponent. Hence, following order :­

argumentSentences.text: [5] After hearing the Ld. Counsel for the applicants, there is reasonable apprehension in the mind of the applicants about their arrest at the hands of non­applicant.
Hence, as settled position of Law, the Applicants are entitled for ad­interim Anticipatory bail till filing of reply by the Opponent.
Hence, following order :­

order.text: ORDER 1] In the event of arrest of the applicants ­ Mahesh Shrihari Gadute and Kiran Baban Hargude in the matter of C.R.No. 21/2019 under Section 326, 324, 323, 504, 506, 143, 147, 148 of the Indian Penal Code registered at Lonikand Police Station, Pune, they be released on their executing P.R. Bond of Rs.15,000/­ each and surety each of like amount. 2] The above mentioned interim protection of ad­interim anticipatory bail is granted, till filing of reply by the Opponent. 3] Issue show cause notice to PSO PS Lonikand Police Station r/on 19/01/2019.

footer: Sd/­ Pune ( G.P.Agrawal ) Date : 11/01/2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. CERTIFICATE I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : Smt. S.N.Kale Name of Court : G.P.Agrawal Addl. Sessions Judge,Pune. Order delivered on : 11/01/2019 Order signed on : 11/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 11/01/2019
processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No. 211/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­000776­2019) Mahesh Shrihari Gadute & Anr. Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Lonikand P.S.) 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 4 Applicants Mahesh Shrihari Gadute and Kiran Baban Hargude have filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Ad­interim Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 21/2019 under Section 326, 324, 323, 504, 506, 143, 147, 148 of the Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
[2] Heard the Ld. Counsel for the Applicants. 
---argument-ends---
[3] The complainant Amit Bhandalkar lodged report with non­applicant on 09.01.2019 stating that Pooja Mahadik, daughter of his tenant told him that day before one, unknown boy was asking her mobile number. Today also that boy standing in front of their building. Therefore, complainant went to that boy to ask, why he is asking the mobile number of Pooja. At that time, that boy abused complainant and there was quarrel between them and that boy left. In the evening at 07.45 p.m. that unknown boy came in front of house of complainant along with his friend and started abusing and threatening complainant. That unknown boy beat the complainant with fist and kick blows. Ravi Hargude and Mahesh Gatude beat him with fist and kick blows. Kiran Hargude with iron rod on his right shoulder. When one Rajendra Lingse tried to intervene, at that time, Omkar Hargude beat him with some pointed instruments on his wrist. . On these allegations, FIR was lodged. 
---argument-ends---
[4] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Nothing incriminating has to be discovered or recovered at the instance of applicants. Initially, the FIR was registered u/s 324 and other offences of IPC. Later on police added Section 326 of I.P.C. The alleged injuries are simple in nature. The applicants have not done any over act. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not necessary. Hence, prayed for ad­interim protection. 
---argument-ends---
[5] After hearing the Ld. Counsel for the applicants, there is reasonable apprehension in the mind of the applicants about their arrest at the hands of non­applicant. Hence, as settled position of Law, the Applicants are entitled for ad­interim Anticipatory bail till filing of reply by the Opponent. Hence, following order :­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] In the event of arrest of the applicants ­ Mahesh Shrihari Gadute and Kiran Baban Hargude in the matter of C.R.No. 21/2019 under Section 326, 324, 323, 504, 506, 143, 147, 148 of the Indian Penal Code registered at Lonikand Police Station, Pune, they be released on their executing P.R. Bond of Rs.15,000/­ each and surety each of like amount. 2] The above mentioned interim protection of ad­interim anticipatory bail is granted, till filing of reply by the Opponent. 3] Issue show cause notice to PSO PS Lonikand Police Station r/on 19/01/2019. 
---order-ends---
Sd/­ Pune ( G.P.Agrawal ) Date : 11/01/2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. CERTIFICATE I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : Smt. S.N.Kale Name of Court : G.P.Agrawal Addl. Sessions Judge,Pune. Order delivered on : 11/01/2019 Order signed on : 11/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 11/01/2019
